name: Path T
title: Pathological T
notes:
**Note 1:** pT for Tis, T1, T2 and T3 can only be assigned if a radical orchiectomy has been performed.

**Note 1:**  Involvement of para-testicular (hilar/mediastinal) soft tissues does not alter the extension code. Code the primary tumor based on other criteria documented in the patient record.
rows: X
TX
Primary tumor cannot be assessed

Unknown extension
Primary tumor cannot be assessed
Not documented in patient record
T0
No evidence of primary tumor
IS
Tis
Intratubular germ cell neoplasia (carcinoma in situ)

In situ, intraepithelial, noninvasive; 
Intratubular germ cell neoplasia
T1

Tumor limited to testis and epidydimis without vascular/lymphatic 
invasion; tumor may invade tunical albuginea but not tunica vaginalis

Body of testis
Rete testis
Tunica albuginea

Localized, NOS

Tunica, NOS

Stated as T1
T2

Tumor limited to testis and epidydimis with vascular/lymphatic 
invasion, or tumor extending through tunica albuginea with involvement
of tunica vaginalis

Tunica vaginalis involved
Tunica, NOS
Surface implants (surface of tunica vaginalis)

Stated as T2
T3

Tumor invades spermatic cord with or without vascular lymphatic/
invasion

Epididymis WITH or WITHOUT tunica vaginalis or surface implants
Spermatic cord, ipsilateral
Vas deferens

Stated as T3
T4
Tumor invades scrotum with or without vascular lymphatic invasion

Dartos muscle, ipsilateral
Extension to scrotum, contralateral
Penis
Scrotum, ipsilateral
Ulceration of scrotum

Further contiguous extension

Stated as T4
